違.definition: to disobey; to violate; to separate; to go against

違令.definition: to disobey; to go against orders

違信背約.definition: in violation of contract and good faith

違別.definition: to leave; to depart; to go against

違利赴名.definition: to renounce profit and seek fame (idiom); to abandon greed for reputation; to choose fame over fortune

違命.definition: disobedient; to violate the Mandate of Heaven (天命[Tian1 Ming4])

違和.definition: unwell; indisposed; out of sorts; euphemism or honorific for ill

違天害理.definition: lit. violating heaven and reason (idiom); immoral character

違天逆理.definition: lit. violating heaven and reason (idiom); immoral character

違建.definition: abbr. for 違章建築|违章建筑, illegal construction

違強凌弱.definition: to avoid the strong and attack the weak (idiom); to bully; also written 違強陵弱|违强陵弱

違強陵弱.definition: to avoid the strong and attack the weak (idiom); to bully

違心.definition: false; untrue to one's convictions; against one's will; disloyal

違心之言.definition: false assertion; speech against one's own convictions

違恩負義.definition: to disobey one's benefactor; to violate debts of gratitude; to repay good with evil

違悖.definition: to transgress; to violate (the rules); same as 違背|违背

違拗.definition: to disobey; to defy; to deliberately go against (a rule, a convention, sb's wishes etc)

違時絕俗.definition: to defy the times and reject custom (idiom); in breach of current conventions

違標.definition: to go against the stipulated criteria

違法亂紀.definition: lit. to break the law and violate the rules (idiom); fig. misconduct

違禁.definition: to violate a prohibition or ban; prohibited; illicit

違章.definition: to break the rules; to violate regulations

違紀.definition: lack of discipline; to break a rule; to violate discipline; to breach a principle

違約.definition: to break a promise; to violate an agreement; to default (on a loan or contract)

違背.definition: to go against; to be contrary to; to violate

違誤.definition: to disobey and cause delays; to obstruct and procrastinate

違逆.definition: to disobey; to defy an edict; to violate; to go against; to run counter to
